StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [DeleteOssProspectEduca.onFromMcriss]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@MarineCandidateID int, @ProspectSchoolTypeId int, @SchoolCode int, @Educa.onLevel varchar(2), @Educa.onCode char(1)
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
DECLARE @ProspectID uniqueiden..er
SELECT Top 1 @ProspectID = ProspectId FROM USMC.Prospect WHERE NwaId IN (SELECT Top 1 rowguid FROM MCRISS.dbo.NWA WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateID ORDER BY NWA_ID DESC)
IF @ProspectID IS NOT NULL BEGIN DECLARE @ID uniqueiden..er DECLARE @SchoolId uniqueiden..er
SELECT @SchoolId = rowguid FROM MCRISS.dbo.HIGH_SCHOOL WHERE SCHOOL_CODE = @SchoolCode
SELECT Top 1 @ID = [ProspectSchoolId] FROM [USMC].[ProspectSchool] WHERE ProspectId = @ProspectID AND SchoolId = @SchoolId AND Educa.onLevel = @Educa.onLevel AND Educa.onCode = @Educa.onCode AND ProspectSchoolTypeId = @ProspectSchoolTypeId
ORDER BY LastUpdateDate Desc
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF @ID IS NOT NULL BEGIN DELETE FROM [USMC].[ProspectSchool] WHERE ProspectSchoolId = @ID
END END -- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
